responsibilities: Lead the design and development of advanced algorithms and software solutions for trusted autonomous systems.
Conduct experiments to explore new AI and ML technologies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, system engineers, and product managers.
Develop Test, Evaluation, Verification, and Validation (TEV&V) procedures and techniques for IAS.
Solve real-world challenges and define ML strategy for key DoD clients.
skills: Experience in AI or ML research and development, with a focus on autonomous systems.
Experience with ML, computer vision, and deep learning algorithms.
Proficiency in programming languages, including Python, C++, or Java.
Ability to develop innovative ML models and algorithms to improve IAS performance.
Ability to present research findings and recommendations to clients and executive leadership.
Ability to build collaboration partnerships with industry and academic institutions.
Ability to identify opportunities for innovation in AI and ML technologies and autonomous systems.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills focus on the design and development of algorithms and software solutions for autonomous systems, with a strong emphasis on AI and ML technologies. The responsibilities include conducting experiments to explore new AI and ML technologies, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and solving real-world challenges for DoD clients. The skills required include experience in AI or ML research and development, proficiency in programming languages, and the ability to develop innovative ML models and algorithms.

There is no specific mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on autonomous systems, computer vision, and deep learning algorithms, which are not necessarily indicative of working with GenAI or LLMs. While the job involves AI and ML, it does not explicitly involve Generative AI or language models.
